item.title: selfie - take 1
item.description:
selfie - take 1

The first assessment of this course is to identify how you represent yourself online, through a selfie, self-portrait, or brand.

item.title: Eight Portrait Photography Rules You Should Try Breaking | Fstoppers
item.description:
Eight Portrait Photography Rules You Should Try Breaking | Fstoppers

There are two characters that sit atop adjacent shoulders either side of my head and squabble over portraiture. One takes the form of my Gran and she sits there quietly knitting and ensuring me that rules are there for a reason and without them there would be chaos; she's the voice of tranquillity, reason and over-feeding.

item.title: Self Portrait - take 2
item.description:
Self Portrait - take 2

A further exploration of self portraiture, this week was a continuation of the assessment from last week. The result, this:

item.title: Map of my Mind
item.description:
Map of my Mind

We're examining the personal 'self' this week - how to reflect your own persona in an image. To stimulate thoughts around this we were encouraged to create a mind map, detailing aspects of ourselves that can be explored photographically.

item.title: Why?
item.description:
Why?

Today we were asked, "Why do we take photos?". It's a good question and for me there's a few answers there.

item.title: Interwebs
item.description:
Interwebs

I've dabbled with a few photo sharing sites over the years. While not particularly active, I frequently lurk and occasionally post at the following locations:

item.title: A beginning...
item.description:
A beginning...

This mini site is the beginning of my photo journal, created for my involvement in the Photography and Social Media course at the University of Tasmania. I'm undertaking the unit externally this semester in an effort to shake off my photographic cobwebs.

item.title: Inspiration
item.description:
Inspiration

We've been asked to browse photo media sites to see what themes inspire us, and which platforms we find most engaging.
